quoteFirst: On the first day the examination of surveyors is continued for four hours, viz. from 2 to 4 and
quoteLast: and consists of written papers only. Inspectors of nuisances have two hours’ written examination on the first day, viz. from 4 to 6 P.M. quoteFirst: In the dog-watches of the evening, after supper, from
quoteLast: , the blue-jacket is given his leisure. It is then that pipes are smoked, vigilance relaxed, boxing and wrestling bouts are in order, and Jacky settles down for his rest after the day of labor.

quoteFirst: “Watch and watch” is the rule on small sailing-vessels: four hours on and four hours off, day and night, except for the “dog watches,” four to six and
quoteTime: six to eight in the evening
quoteLast: , which create a daily shift in order that each man may be on watch at a different time on successive days. Always provided, of course, that the ship has any watches at all! I _have_ sailed in a Pacific schooner where the crew spent most of their time playing the accordion and the Jew’s harp, and slept peacefully all night.
title: In the Strange South Seas
author: Grimshaw, Beatrice, 1871-1953

quoteLast: , when the watch is set. They are thus changed every night, one having eight hours on deck and four below one night, and the next _vice versa_, continuing thus for the voyage.
